Name: Google Street View
Description: Basic 360 maker software

Name: Samsung Gear Action Director
Description: Intermediate 360 video maker software

Name: Adobe Premier with Mettle
Description: 360 video maker software

Name: Youtube Gyroscopic
Description: 360 video viewing software

Name: BlippAR
Description: Basic AR developing and viewing software

Name: Vuforia
Description: Intermediate AR developing software

Name: Unity/ARToolKit
Description: Advanced AR developing software
Notes:
Unity/AR Toolkit must be used with:
- Android SDK for Android devices
- X Code for iOS devices (also requires an apple ID)

Name: InstaVR
Description: Basic VR developing software
Compatibility: HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, Gear VR, Google Daydream, Android, iOS, and most Internet browsers

Name: A-Frame
Description: Intermediate VR developing software

Name: Unity
Description: Advanced VR developing software
Compatibility: HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, Gear VR, Google Daydream, Android, iOS, and most Internet browsers

Name: Google Earth VR
Description: Google Earth VR lets you explore the world from totally new perspectives in virtual reality. Stroll the streets of Tokyo, soar over the Grand Canyon, or walk around the Eiffel Tower.

Name: The Body VR
Description: Journey Inside a Cell is an educational virtual reality experience that takes the user inside the human body.

Name: Google Tilt Brush
Description: Tilt Brush lets you paint in 3D space with virtual reality. Unleash your creativity with three-dimensional brush strokes, stars, light, and even fire. Your room is your canvas.

Name: The Lab
Description: Compilation of Valve’s room-scale VR experiments set in a pocket universe within Aperture Science. Fix a robot, defend a castle, adopt a mechanical dog, and more.

Name: InMind VR
Description: InMind is a short scientific adventure with arcade elements designed for the Oculus VR. Submerge into the microworld and experience the miracles of the human mind.
Compatibility: HTC Vive, Oculus Rift, iOS, Android

Name: Richie's Plank Experience
Description: Take an elevator to our plank that’s sits 160m high above the ground, then dare to walk to the end! An experience made for first-time VR users.
Play Type: Motion Tracking: requires a play area of at least 6.5ft (2m)  x 5.9ft (1.8m).

Name: VR Museum of Fine Arts
Description: See famous life-size scultpures and paintings with the use of VR.

Name: Blocks by Google
Description: Blocks lets you easily create 3D objects in virtual reality, no matter your modelling experience. Using six simple tools, you can bring your applications to life, create a volumetric masterpiece, or simply let your imagination run wild.

Name: Sisters
Description: Be careful where you look, because something doesn't want you here! Uncover the mysteries and solve the puzzles of the house, rescue your sister, and escape before it's too late.

Name: Proton Pulse
Description: 3D Arcade Brick-Breaking Action from a whole new perspective

Name: Surge
Description: Surge is one of the first real-time VR music videos created for the new generation VR headsets and gives amazing insight in the possibilities of VR as a medium.

Name: Disney VR
Description: This app is a fully-immersive experience where you visit themed worlds, including Disney, Marvel and Lucasfilm, and interact with some of your favorite characters in their natural environments.

Name: Richie's Plank Experience
Description: Are you afraid of heights? Take an elevator to our plank that's sits 160m high above the ground, then dare to walk to the end!
